rows.arabic: يَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلْأَنفَالِ ۖ قُلِ ٱلْأَنفَالُ لِلَّهِ وَٱلرَّسُولِ ۖ فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَصْلِحُوا۟ ذَاتَ بَيْنِكُمْ ۖ وَأَطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥٓ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: They ask you concerning the anfaal. Say, ‘The anfaal belong to Allah and the Apostle.’ So be wary of Allah and settle your differences, and obey Allah and His Apostle, should you be faithful.
rows.transliteration: yas-alūnaka `anil-anfāl ۖ qulil-anfālu lillāhi war rasūl ۖ fattaqullāha wa-aṣliḥū dhāta baynikum ۖ wa-aṭī`ullāha warasūlahu in kuntum mu-minīn

bismillah.translation: In the Name of Allah, the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.

rows.arabic: إِنَّمَا ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِرَ ٱللَّهُ وَجِلَتْ قُلُوبُهُمْ وَإِذَا تُلِيَتْ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتُهُۥ زَادَتْهُمْ إِيمَـٰنًا وَعَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَتَوَكَّلُونَ
rows.translation: The faithful are only those whose hearts tremble [with awe] when Allah is mentioned, and when His signs are recited to them, they increase their faith, and who put their trust in their Lord,
rows.transliteration: innamal mu-minūnal ladhīna idhā dhukirallāhu wajilat qulūbuhum wa idhā tuliyat `alayhim āyātuhu zādat-hum-iymānan wa`alā rabbihim yatawakkalūn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَمِمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰهُمْ يُنفِقُونَ
rows.translation: maintain the prayer and spend out of what We have provided them.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna yuqīmūnaṣ ṣalāta wa mimmā razaqnāhum yunfiqūn

rows.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ حَقًّا ۚ لَّهُمْ دَرَجَـٰتٌ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ وَمَغْفِرَةٌ وَرِزْقٌ كَرِيمٌ
rows.translation: It is they who are truly the faithful. They shall have ranks near their Lord, forgiveness and a noble provision.
rows.transliteration: ulā-ika humul mu-minūna ḥaqqā ۚ lahum darajātun `inda rabbihim wa maghfiratun warizqun karīm

rows.arabic: كَمَآ أَخْرَجَكَ رَبُّكَ مِنۢ بَيْتِكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَإِنَّ فَرِيقًا مِّنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ لَكَـٰرِهُونَ
rows.translation: As your Lord brought you out from your home with a just cause, a part of the faithful were indeed reluctant.
rows.transliteration: kamā akhrajaka rabbuka min baytika bil ḥaqqi wa inna farīqan minal mu-minīna lakārihūn

rows.arabic: يُجَـٰدِلُونَكَ فِى ٱلْحَقِّ بَعْدَ مَا تَبَيَّنَ كَأَنَّمَا يُسَاقُونَ إِلَى ٱلْمَوْتِ وَهُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
rows.translation: They disputed with you concerning the truth after it had become clear, as if they were being driven towards death as they looked on.
rows.transliteration: yujādilūnaka fil ḥaqqi ba`da mā tabayyana ka-annamā yusāqūna ilal-mawti wahum yanẓurūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ يَعِدُكُمُ ٱللَّهُ إِحْدَى ٱلطَّآئِفَتَيْنِ أَنَّهَا لَكُمْ وَتَوَدُّونَ أَنَّ غَيْرَ ذَاتِ ٱلشَّوْكَةِ تَكُونُ لَكُمْ وَيُرِيدُ ٱللَّهُ أَن يُحِقَّ ٱلْحَقَّ بِكَلِمَـٰتِهِۦ وَيَقْطَعَ دَابِرَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: When Allah promised you [victory over] one of the two companies, [saying], ‘It is for you,’ you were eager that it should be the one that was unarmed. But Allah desires to confirm the truth with His words, and to root out the faithless,
rows.transliteration: wa idh ya`idukumullāhu iḥdaṭ ṭā-ifatayni annahā lakum watawaddūna anna ghayra dhātish shawkati takūnu lakum wayurīdullāhu an yuḥiqqal ḥaqqa bikalimātihi wayaqṭa`a dābiral kāfirīn

rows.arabic: لِيُحِقَّ ٱلْحَقَّ وَيُبْطِلَ ٱلْبَـٰطِلَ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
rows.translation: so that He may confirm the truth and bring falsehood to naught, though the guilty should be averse.
rows.transliteration: liyuḥiqqal ḥaqqa wayubṭilal-bāṭila walaw karihal mujrimūn

rows.arabic: إِذْ تَسْتَغِيثُونَ رَبَّكُمْ فَٱسْتَجَابَ لَكُمْ أَنِّى مُمِدُّكُم بِأَلْفٍ مِّنَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ مُرْدِفِينَ
rows.translation: When you appealed to your Lord for help, He answered you: ‘I will aid you with a thousand angels in a file.’
rows.transliteration: idh tastaghīthūna rabbakum fastajāba lakum annī mumiddukum bi-alfin minal malā-ikati murdifīn

rows.arabic: وَمَا جَعَلَهُ ٱللَّهُ إِلَّا بُشْرَىٰ وَلِتَطْمَئِنَّ بِهِۦ قُلُوبُكُمْ ۚ وَمَا ٱلنَّصْرُ إِلَّا مِنْ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
rows.translation: Allah did not appoint it but as a good news, and to reassure your hearts. Victory comes only from Allah. Indeed Allah is all-mighty, all-wise.
rows.transliteration: wa mā ja`alahullāhu illā bushrā walitaṭma-inna bihi qulūbukum ۚ wa man naṣru illā min `indillāh ۚ innallāha `azīzun ḥakīm

rows.arabic: إِذْ يُغَشِّيكُمُ ٱلنُّعَاسَ أَمَنَةً مِّنْهُ وَيُنَزِّلُ عَلَيْكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً لِّيُطَهِّرَكُم بِهِۦ وَيُذْهِبَ عَنكُمْ رِجْزَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ وَلِيَرْبِطَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِكُمْ وَيُثَبِّتَ بِهِ ٱلْأَقْدَامَ
rows.translation: When He covered you with a trance as a [sense of] security from Him, and He sent down water from the sky to purify you with it, and to repel from you the defilement of Satan, and to fortify your hearts, and to make [your] feet steady with it.
rows.transliteration: idh yughashhīkumun nu`āsa amanatan minhu wayunazzilu `alaykum minas samā-i mā-an liyuṭahhirakum bihi wayudh-hiba `ankum rijzash shayṭāni waliyarbiṭa `alā qulūbikum wayuthabbita bihil-aqdām

rows.arabic: إِذْ يُوحِى رَبُّكَ إِلَى ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ أَنِّى مَعَكُمْ فَثَبِّتُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ۚ سَأُلْقِى فِى قُلُوبِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ٱلرُّعْبَ فَٱضْرِبُوا۟ فَوْقَ ٱلْأَعْنَاقِ وَٱضْرِبُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ كُلَّ بَنَانٍ
rows.translation: Then your Lord signaled to the angels: ‘I am indeed with you; so steady the faithful. I will cast terror into the hearts of the faithless. So strike their necks, and strike their every limb joint!’
rows.transliteration: idh yūḥī rabbuka ilal-malā-ikati annī ma`akum fathabbitul ladhīna āmanū ۚ sa-ulqī fī qulūbil ladhīna kafarur ru`ba faḍribū fawqal-a`nāqi waḍribū minhum kulla banān

rows.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ شَآقُّوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ ۚ وَمَن يُشَاقِقِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
rows.translation: That, because they defied Allah and His Apostle. And whoever defies Allah and His Apostle, Allah is indeed severe in retribution.
rows.transliteration: dhālika bi-annahum shāqqullāha warasūlah ۚ wa man yushāqiqillāha warasūlahu fa-innallāha shadīdul `iqāb

rows.arabic: ذَٰلِكُمْ فَذُوقُوهُ وَأَنَّ لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ
rows.translation: ‘Taste this, and [know] that for the faithless is the punishment of the Fire.’
rows.transliteration: dhālikum fadhūqūhu wa-anna lilkāfirīna `adhāban nār

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا لَقِيتُمُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ زَحْفًا فَلَا تُوَلُّوهُمُ ٱلْأَدْبَارَ
rows.translation: O you who have faith! When you encounter the faithless advancing [for battle], do not turn your backs [to flee] from them.
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanū idhā laqītumul ladhīna kafarū zaḥfan falā tuwallūhumul-adbār

rows.arabic: وَمَن يُوَلِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ دُبُرَهُۥٓ إِلَّا مُتَحَرِّفًا لِّقِتَالٍ أَوْ مُتَحَيِّزًا إِلَىٰ فِئَةٍ فَقَدْ بَآءَ بِغَضَبٍ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَمَأْوَىٰهُ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
rows.translation: Whoever turns his back [to flee] from them that day—unless [he is] diverting to fight or retiring towards another troop—shall certainly earn Allah’s wrath, and his refuge shall be hell, an evil destination.
rows.transliteration: wa man yuwallihim yawma-idhin duburahu illā mutaḥarrifal liqitālin aw mutaḥayyizan ilā fi-atin faqad bā-a bighaḍabin minallāhi wa ma-wāhu jahannam ۖ wabi-sal maṣīr

rows.arabic: فَلَمْ تَقْتُلُوهُمْ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَتَلَهُمْ ۚ وَمَا رَمَيْتَ إِذْ رَمَيْتَ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ رَمَىٰ ۚ وَلِيُبْلِىَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ مِنْهُ بَلَآءً حَسَنًا ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: You did not kill them; rather, it was Allah who killed them; and you did not throw when you threw, rather, it was Allah who threw, that He might test the faithful with a good test from Himself. Indeed Allah is all-hearing, all-knowing.
rows.transliteration: falam taqtulūhum walākinnallāha qatalahum ۚ wa mā ramayta idh ramayta walākinnallāha ramā ۚ waliyubliyal mu-minīna minhu balā-an ḥasanā ۚ innallāha samī`un `alīm

rows.arabic: ذَٰلِكُمْ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ مُوهِنُ كَيْدِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: Such is the case, and [know] that Allah undermines the stratagems of the faithless.
rows.transliteration: dhālikum wa-annallāha mūhinu kaydil kāfirīn

rows.arabic: إِن تَسْتَفْتِحُوا۟ فَقَدْ جَآءَكُمُ ٱلْفَتْحُ ۖ وَإِن تَنتَهُوا۟ فَهُوَ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ ۖ وَإِن تَعُودُوا۟ نَعُدْ وَلَن تُغْنِىَ عَنكُمْ فِئَتُكُمْ شَيْـًٔا وَلَوْ كَثُرَتْ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: If you sought a verdict, the verdict has certainly come to you; and if you cease [your belligerence against the Prophet and his followers], it is better for you, but if you resume, We [too] shall return and your troops will never avail you though they should be ever so many, and [know] that Allah is with the faithful.
rows.transliteration: in tastaftiḥū faqad jā-akumul fat-ḥ ۖ wa in tantahū fahuwa khayrul lakum ۖ wa in ta`ūdū na`ud walan tughniya `ankum fi-atukum shay-an walaw kathurat wa-annallāha ma`al mu-minīn

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ وَلَا تَوَلَّوْا۟ عَنْهُ وَأَنتُمْ تَسْمَعُونَ
rows.translation: O you who have faith! Obey Allah and His Apostle, and do not turn away from him while you hear [him].
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanū aṭī`ullāha warasūlahu walā tawallaw `anhu wa-antum tasma`ūn

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ كَٱلَّذِينَ قَالُوا۟ سَمِعْنَا وَهُمْ لَا يَسْمَعُونَ
rows.translation: Do not be like those who say, ‘We hear,’ though they do not hear.
rows.transliteration: walā takūnū kal ladhīna qālū sami`nā wahum lā yasma`ūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ شَرَّ ٱلدَّوَآبِّ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلصُّمُّ ٱلْبُكْمُ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: Indeed the worst of beasts in Allah’s sight are the deaf and dumb who do not exercise their reason.
rows.transliteration: inna sharrad dawābbi `indallāhiṣ ṣummul bukmul ladhīna lā ya`qilūn

rows.arabic: وَلَوْ عَلِمَ ٱللَّهُ فِيهِمْ خَيْرًا لَّأَسْمَعَهُمْ ۖ وَلَوْ أَسْمَعَهُمْ لَتَوَلَّوا۟ وَّهُم مُّعْرِضُونَ
rows.translation: Had Allah known any good in them, He would have surely made them hear, and were He to make them hear, surely they would turn away, being disregardful.
rows.transliteration: walaw `alimallāhu fīhim khayral la-asma`ahum ۖ walaw asma`ahum latawallaw wahum mu`riḍūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لِلَّهِ وَلِلرَّسُولِ إِذَا دَعَاكُمْ لِمَا يُحْيِيكُمْ ۖ وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَحُولُ بَيْنَ ٱلْمَرْءِ وَقَلْبِهِۦ وَأَنَّهُۥٓ إِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
rows.translation: O you who have faith! Answer Allah and the Apostle when he summons you to that which will give you life. Know that Allah intervenes between a man and his heart and that toward Him you will be mustered.
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanus-tajībū lillāhi walirrasūli idhā da`ākum limā yuḥyīkum ۖ wa`lamū annallāha yaḥūlu baynal mar-i waqalbihi wa-annahu ilayhi tuḥsharūn

rows.arabic: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ فِتْنَةً لَّا تُصِيبَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ مِنكُمْ خَآصَّةً ۖ وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
rows.translation: And beware of a punishment, which shall not visit the wrongdoers among you exclusively, and know that Allah is severe in retribution.
rows.transliteration: wattaqū fitnatan lā tuṣībannal ladhīna ẓalamū minkum khāṣṣah ۖ wa`lamū annallāha shadīdul `iqāb

rows.arabic: وَٱذْكُرُوٓا۟ إِذْ أَنتُمْ قَلِيلٌ مُّسْتَضْعَفُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ تَخَافُونَ أَن يَتَخَطَّفَكُمُ ٱلنَّاسُ فَـَٔاوَىٰكُمْ وَأَيَّدَكُم بِنَصْرِهِۦ وَرَزَقَكُم مِّنَ ٱلطَّيِّبَـٰتِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: Remember when you were few, abased in the land, and feared lest the people should despoil you, and He gave you refuge, and strengthened you with His help, and provided you with all the good things so that you may give thanks.
rows.transliteration: wadhkurū idh antum qalīlun mustaḍ`afūna fil-arḍi takhāfūna an yatakhaṭṭafakumun nāsu fa-āwākum wa-ayyadakum binaṣrihi warazaqakum minaṭ ṭayyibāti la`allakum tashkurūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَخُونُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱلرَّسُولَ وَتَخُونُوٓا۟ أَمَـٰنَـٰتِكُمْ وَأَنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: O you who have faith! Do not betray Allah and the Apostle, and do not betray your trusts knowingly.
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanū lā takhūnullāha war rasūla watakhūnū amānātikum wa-antum ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّمَآ أَمْوَٰلُكُمْ وَأَوْلَـٰدُكُمْ فِتْنَةٌ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ عِندَهُۥٓ أَجْرٌ عَظِيمٌ
rows.translation: Know that your possessions and children are only a test, and that Allah—with Him is a great reward.
rows.transliteration: wa`lamū annamā amwālukum wa-awlādukum fitnatun wa-annallāha `indahu ajrun `aẓīm

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِن تَتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ يَجْعَل لَّكُمْ فُرْقَانًا وَيُكَفِّرْ عَنكُمْ سَيِّـَٔاتِكُمْ وَيَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلْفَضْلِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
rows.translation: O you who have faith! If you are wary of Allah, He shall appoint a criterion for you, and absolve you of your misdeeds, and forgive you, for Allah is dispenser of a great grace.
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanū in tattaqullāha yaj`al lakum furqānan wayukaffir `ankum sayyi-ātikum wayaghfir lakum ۗ wallāhu dhul faḍlil `aẓīm

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ يَمْكُرُ بِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِيُثْبِتُوكَ أَوْ يَقْتُلُوكَ أَوْ يُخْرِجُوكَ ۚ وَيَمْكُرُونَ وَيَمْكُرُ ٱللَّهُ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ خَيْرُ ٱلْمَـٰكِرِينَ
rows.translation: When the faithless plotted against you to take you captive, or to kill or expel you—they plotted and Allah devised, and Allah is the best of devisers.
rows.transliteration: wa idh yamkuru bikal ladhīna kafarū liyuthbitūka aw yaqtulūka aw yukhrijūk ۚ wayamkurūna wayamkurullāh ۖ wallāhu khayrul mākirīn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالُوا۟ قَدْ سَمِعْنَا لَوْ نَشَآءُ لَقُلْنَا مِثْلَ هَـٰذَآ ۙ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّآ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
rows.translation: When Our signs are recited to them, they say, ‘We have heard already. If we want, we [too] can say like this. These are nothing but myths of the ancients.’
rows.transliteration: wa idhā tutlā `alayhim āyātunā qālū qad sami`nā law nashā-u laqulnā mithla hādhā in hādhā illā asāṭīrul-awwalīn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالُوا۟ ٱللَّهُمَّ إِن كَانَ هَـٰذَا هُوَ ٱلْحَقَّ مِنْ عِندِكَ فَأَمْطِرْ عَلَيْنَا حِجَارَةً مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَوِ ٱئْتِنَا بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
rows.translation: And when they said, ‘O Allah, if this be the truth from You, rain down upon us stones from the sky, or bring us a painful punishment.’
rows.transliteration: wa idh qālullāhumma in kāna hādhā huwal ḥaqqa min `indika fa-amṭir `alaynā ḥijāratan minas samā-i awi-tinā bi`adhābin alīm

rows.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ ٱللَّهُ لِيُعَذِّبَهُمْ وَأَنتَ فِيهِمْ ۚ وَمَا كَانَ ٱللَّهُ مُعَذِّبَهُمْ وَهُمْ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ
rows.translation: But Allah will not punish them while you are in their midst, nor will Allah punish them while they plead for forgiveness.
rows.transliteration: wa mā kānallāhu liyu`adhhibahum wa-anta fīhim ۚ wa mā kānallāhu mu`adhhibahum wahum yastaghfirūn

rows.arabic: وَمَا لَهُمْ أَلَّا يُعَذِّبَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ وَهُمْ يَصُدُّونَ عَنِ ٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْحَرَامِ وَمَا كَانُوٓا۟ أَوْلِيَآءَهُۥٓ ۚ إِنْ أَوْلِيَآؤُهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱلْمُتَّقُونَ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: What [excuse] have they that Allah should not punish them, when they bar [the faithful] from the Holy Mosque, and they are not its custodians? Its custodians are only the Godwary, but most of them do not know.
rows.transliteration: wa mā lahum allā yu`adhhibahumullāhu wahum yaṣuddūna `anil masjidil ḥarāmi wa mā kānū awliyā-ah ۚ in awliyā-uhu illal-muttaqūna walākinna aktharahum lā ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ صَلَاتُهُمْ عِندَ ٱلْبَيْتِ إِلَّا مُكَآءً وَتَصْدِيَةً ۚ فَذُوقُوا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْفُرُونَ
rows.translation: Their prayer at the House is nothing but whistling and clapping. So taste the punishment because of what you used to defy.
rows.transliteration: wa mā kāna ṣalātuhum `indal bayti illā mukā-an wataṣdiyah ۚ fadhūqul `adhāba bimā kuntum takfurūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ يُنفِقُونَ أَمْوَٰلَهُمْ لِيَصُدُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ فَسَيُنفِقُونَهَا ثُمَّ تَكُونُ عَلَيْهِمْ حَسْرَةً ثُمَّ يُغْلَبُونَ ۗ وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ يُحْشَرُونَ
rows.translation: Indeed the faithless spend their wealth to bar from the way of Allah. Soon they will have spent it, then it will be a cause of regret to them, then they will be overcome, and the faithless will be gathered toward Hell,
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna kafarū yunfiqūna amwālahum liyaṣuddū `an sabīlillāh ۚ fasayunfiqūnahā thumma takūnu `alayhim ḥasratan thumma yughlabūn ۗ wal ladhīna kafarū ilā jahannama yuḥsharūn

rows.arabic: لِيَمِيزَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْخَبِيثَ مِنَ ٱلطَّيِّبِ وَيَجْعَلَ ٱلْخَبِيثَ بَعْضَهُۥ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ فَيَرْكُمَهُۥ جَمِيعًا فَيَجْعَلَهُۥ فِى جَهَنَّمَ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْخَـٰسِرُونَ
rows.translation: so that Allah may separate the bad ones from the good, and place the bad on one another, and pile them up together, and cast them into hell. It is they who are the losers.
rows.transliteration: liyamīzallāhul khabītha minaṭ ṭayyibi wayaj`alal-khabītha ba`ḍahu `alā ba`ḍin fayarkumahu jamī`an fayaj`alahu fī jahannam ۚ ulā-ika humul khāsirūn

rows.arabic: قُل لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ إِن يَنتَهُوا۟ يُغْفَرْ لَهُم مَّا قَدْ سَلَفَ وَإِن يَعُودُوا۟ فَقَدْ مَضَتْ سُنَّتُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
rows.translation: Say to the faithless, if they cease [their belligerence against the Muslims], what is already past shall be forgiven them. But if they resume [their hostilities], then the precedent of the predecessors has already come to pass.
rows.transliteration: qul lilladhīna kafarū in yantahū yughfar lahum mā qad salafa wa in ya`ūdū faqad maḍat sunnatul-awwalīn

rows.arabic: وَقَـٰتِلُوهُمْ حَتَّىٰ لَا تَكُونَ فِتْنَةٌ وَيَكُونَ ٱلدِّينُ كُلُّهُۥ لِلَّهِ ۚ فَإِنِ ٱنتَهَوْا۟ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
rows.translation: Fight them until persecution is no more, and religion becomes exclusively for Allah. So if they desist, Allah indeed watches what they do.
rows.transliteration: waqātilūhum ḥattā lā takūna fitnatun wayakūnad dīnu kulluhu lillāh ۚ fa-inin-tahaw fa-innallāha bimā ya`malūna baṣīr

rows.arabic: وَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَوْلَىٰكُمْ ۚ نِعْمَ ٱلْمَوْلَىٰ وَنِعْمَ ٱلنَّصِيرُ
rows.translation: But if they turn away, then know that Allah is your master: an excellent master and an excellent helper!
rows.transliteration: wa in tawallaw fa`lamū annallāha mawlākum ۚ ni`mal mawlā wani`man naṣīr

rows.arabic: وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّمَا غَنِمْتُم مِّن شَىْءٍ فَأَنَّ لِلَّهِ خُمُسَهُۥ وَلِلرَّسُولِ وَلِذِى ٱلْقُرْبَىٰ وَٱلْيَتَـٰمَىٰ وَٱلْمَسَـٰكِينِ وَٱبْنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ إِن كُنتُمْ ءَامَنتُم بِٱللَّهِ وَمَآ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَىٰ عَبْدِنَا يَوْمَ ٱلْفُرْقَانِ يَوْمَ ٱلْتَقَى ٱلْجَمْعَانِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
rows.translation: Know that whatever thing you may come by, a fifth of it is for Allah and the Apostle, for the relatives and the orphans, for the needy and the traveller, if you have faith in Allah and what We sent down to Our servant on the Day of Separation, the day when the two hosts met; and Allah has power over all things.
rows.transliteration: wa`lamū annamā ghanimtum min shay-in fa-anna lillāhi khumusahu walirrasūli walidhil qurbā wal yatāmā wal masākīni wabnis sabīli in kuntum āmantum billāhi wa mā anzalnā `alā `abdinā yawmal furqāni yawmal taqal jam`ān ۗ wallāhu `alā kulli shay-in qadīr

rows.arabic: إِذْ أَنتُم بِٱلْعُدْوَةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَهُم بِٱلْعُدْوَةِ ٱلْقُصْوَىٰ وَٱلرَّكْبُ أَسْفَلَ مِنكُمْ ۚ وَلَوْ تَوَاعَدتُّمْ لَٱخْتَلَفْتُمْ فِى ٱلْمِيعَـٰدِ ۙ وَلَـٰكِن لِّيَقْضِىَ ٱللَّهُ أَمْرًا كَانَ مَفْعُولًا لِّيَهْلِكَ مَنْ هَلَكَ عَنۢ بَيِّنَةٍ وَيَحْيَىٰ مَنْ حَىَّ عَنۢ بَيِّنَةٍ ۗ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَسَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: When you were on the nearer side, and they on the farther side, while the caravan was below you, and had you agreed together on an encounter, you would have certainly failed to keep the tryst, but in order that Allah may carry through a matter that was bound to be fulfilled, so that he who perishes might perish by a manifest proof, and he who lives may live on by a manifest proof, and Allah is indeed all-hearing, all-knowing.
rows.transliteration: idh antum bil `udwatid dunyā wahum bil `udwatil quṣwā war rakbu asfala minkum ۚ walaw tawā`adtum lakhtalaftum fil mī`ādi walākin liyaqḍiyallāhu amran kāna maf`ūlal liyahlika man halaka `an bayyinatin wayaḥyā man ḥayya `an bayyinah ۗ wa innallāha lasamī`un `alīm

rows.arabic: إِذْ يُرِيكَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ فِى مَنَامِكَ قَلِيلًا ۖ وَلَوْ أَرَىٰكَهُمْ كَثِيرًا لَّفَشِلْتُمْ وَلَتَنَـٰزَعْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَمْرِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَلَّمَ ۗ إِنَّهُۥ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
rows.translation: When Allah showed them to you as few in your dream, and had He shown them as many, you would have lost heart, and disputed about the matter. But Allah spared you. Indeed He knows well what is in the breasts.
rows.transliteration: idh yurīkahumullāhu fī manāmika qalīlā ۖ walaw arākahum kathīral lafashiltum walatanāza`tum fil-amri walākinnallāha sallam ۗ innahu `alīmun bidhātiṣ ṣudūr

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ يُرِيكُمُوهُمْ إِذِ ٱلْتَقَيْتُمْ فِىٓ أَعْيُنِكُمْ قَلِيلًا وَيُقَلِّلُكُمْ فِىٓ أَعْيُنِهِمْ لِيَقْضِىَ ٱللَّهُ أَمْرًا كَانَ مَفْعُولًا ۗ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ تُرْجَعُ ٱلْأُمُورُ
rows.translation: And when He showed them to you as few in your eyes, when you met them [on the battlefield], and He made you [appear] few in their eyes, [it was] in order that Allah may carry through a matter that was bound to be fulfilled, and to Allah all matters are returned.
rows.transliteration: wa idh yurīkumūhum idhil taqaytum fī a`yunikum qalīlan wayuqallilukum fī a`yunihim liyaqḍiyallāhu amran kāna maf`ūlā ۗ wa ilallāhi turja`ul-umūr

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا لَقِيتُمْ فِئَةً فَٱثْبُتُوا۟ وَٱذْكُرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
rows.translation: O you who have faith! When you meet a host [in battle], then stand firm, and remember Allah greatly so that you may be felicitous.
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhal ladhīna āmanū idhā laqītum fi-atan fathbutū wadhkurullāha kathīral la`allakum tufliḥūn

rows.arabic: وَأَطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ وَلَا تَنَـٰزَعُوا۟ فَتَفْشَلُوا۟ وَتَذْهَبَ رِيحُكُمْ ۖ وَٱصْبِرُوٓا۟ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
rows.translation: And obey Allah and His Apostle, and do not dispute, or you will lose heart and your power will be gone. And be patient; indeed Allah is with the patient.
rows.transliteration: wa-aṭī`ullāha warasūlahu walā tanāza`ū fatafshalū watadh-haba rīḥukum ۖ waṣbirū ۚ innallāha ma`aṣ ṣābirīn

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ كَٱلَّذِينَ خَرَجُوا۟ مِن دِيَـٰرِهِم بَطَرًا وَرِئَآءَ ٱلنَّاسِ وَيَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ مُحِيطٌ
rows.translation: Do not be like those who left their homes vainly and to show off to the people, and to bar [other people] from the way of Allah, and Allah comprehends what they do.
rows.transliteration: walā takūnū kal ladhīna kharajū min diyārihim baṭaran wari-ā-an nāsi wayaṣuddūna `an sabīlillāh ۚ wallāhu bimā ya`malūna muḥīṭ

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ زَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ وَقَالَ لَا غَالِبَ لَكُمُ ٱلْيَوْمَ مِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ وَإِنِّى جَارٌ لَّكُمْ ۖ فَلَمَّا تَرَآءَتِ ٱلْفِئَتَانِ نَكَصَ عَلَىٰ عَقِبَيْهِ وَقَالَ إِنِّى بَرِىٓءٌ مِّنكُمْ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰ مَا لَا تَرَوْنَ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ ٱللَّهَ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
rows.translation: When Satan made their deeds seem decorous to them, and said [to the faithless], ‘No one shall overcome you today from among all mankind, and I will stand by you.’ But when the two hosts sighted each other, he took to his heels, saying, ‘Indeed I am quit of you. I see what you do not see. Indeed I fear Allah, and Allah is severe in retribution.’
rows.transliteration: wa idh zayyana lahumush shayṭānu a`mālahum waqāla lā ghāliba lakumul yawma minan nāsi wa innī jārul lakum ۖ falammā tarā-atil fi-atāni nakaṣa `alā `aqibayhi waqāla innī barī-un minkum innī arā mā lā tarawna innī akhāfullāh ۚ wallāhu shadīdul `iqāb

rows.arabic: إِذْ يَقُولُ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقُونَ وَٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ غَرَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ دِينُهُمْ ۗ وَمَن يَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
rows.translation: When the hypocrites said, and [also] those in whose hearts is a sickness, ‘Their religion has deceived them.’ But whoever puts his trust in Allah, then Allah is indeed all-mighty, all-wise.
rows.transliteration: idh yaqūlul munāfiqūna wal ladhīna fī qulūbihim maraḍun gharra hā-ulā-i dīnuhum ۗ wa man yatawakkal `alallāhi fa-innallāha `azīzun ḥakīm

rows.arabic: وَلَوْ تَرَىٰٓ إِذْ يَتَوَفَّى ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ۙ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ يَضْرِبُونَ وُجُوهَهُمْ وَأَدْبَـٰرَهُمْ وَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابَ ٱلْحَرِيقِ
rows.translation: Were you to see when the angels take away the faithless, striking their faces and their backs, [saying], ‘Taste the punishment of the burning.
rows.transliteration: walaw tarā idh yatawaffal ladhīna kafarul malā-ikatu yaḍribūna wujūhahum wa-adbārahum wadhūqū `adhābal ḥarīq

rows.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيكُمْ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَيْسَ بِظَلَّـٰمٍ لِّلْعَبِيدِ
rows.translation: That is because of what your hands have sent ahead, and because Allah is not tyrannical to the servants.’
rows.transliteration: dhālika bimā qaddamat aydīkum wa-annallāha laysa biẓallāmin lil`abīd

rows.arabic: كَدَأْبِ ءَالِ فِرْعَوْنَ ۙ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِذُنُوبِهِمْ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَوِىٌّ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
rows.translation: Like the precedent of Pharaoh’s clan and those who were before them, who defied Allah’s signs, so Allah seized them for their sins. Indeed Allah is all-strong, severe in retribution.
rows.transliteration: kada-bi āli fir`awna wal ladhīna min qablihim ۚ kafarū bi-āyātillāhi fa-akhadhahumullāhu bidhunūbihim ۗ innallāha qawiyyun shadīdul `iqāb

rows.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَمْ يَكُ مُغَيِّرًا نِّعْمَةً أَنْعَمَهَا عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍ حَتَّىٰ يُغَيِّرُوا۟ مَا بِأَنفُسِهِمْ ۙ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: That is because Allah never changes a blessing that He has bestowed on a people unless they change what is in their own souls, and Allah is all-hearing, all-knowing:
rows.transliteration: dhālika bi-annallāha lam yaku mughayyiran ni`matan an`amahā `alā qawmin ḥattā yughayyirū mā bi-anfusihim wa-annallāha samī`un `alīm

rows.arabic: كَدَأْبِ ءَالِ فِرْعَوْنَ ۙ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَهْلَكْنَـٰهُم بِذُنُوبِهِمْ وَأَغْرَقْنَآ ءَالَ فِرْعَوْنَ ۚ وَكُلٌّ كَانُوا۟ ظَـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: Like the precedent of Pharaoh’s clan and those who were before them, who denied the signs of their Lord; so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned Pharaoh’s clan; and they were all wrongdoers.
rows.transliteration: kada-bi āli fir`awna wal ladhīna min qablihim ۚ kadhhabū bi-āyāti rabbihim fa-ahlaknāhum bidhunūbihim wa-aghraqnā āla fir`awn ۚ wakullun kānū ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ شَرَّ ٱلدَّوَآبِّ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: Indeed the worst of beasts in Allah’s sight are those who are faithless; so they will not have faith.
rows.transliteration: inna sharrad dawābbi `indallāhil ladhīna kafarū fahum lā yu-minūn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ عَـٰهَدتَّ مِنْهُمْ ثُمَّ يَنقُضُونَ عَهْدَهُمْ فِى كُلِّ مَرَّةٍ وَهُمْ لَا يَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: —Those with whom you made a treaty, and who violated their treaty every time, and who are not Godwary.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna `āhadta minhum thumma yanquḍūna `ahdahum fī kulli marratin wahum lā yattaqūn

rows.arabic: فَإِمَّا تَثْقَفَنَّهُمْ فِى ٱلْحَرْبِ فَشَرِّدْ بِهِم مَّنْ خَلْفَهُمْ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَذَّكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: So if you confront them in battle, treat them [in such a wise] as to disperse those who are behind them, so that they may take admonition.
rows.transliteration: fa-immā tathqafannahum fil ḥarbi fasharrid bihim man khalfahum la`allahum yadhhakkarūn

rows.arabic: وَإِمَّا تَخَافَنَّ مِن قَوْمٍ خِيَانَةً فَٱنۢبِذْ إِلَيْهِمْ عَلَىٰ سَوَآءٍ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْخَآئِنِينَ
rows.translation: And if you fear treachery from a people, break off [the treaty] with them in a like manner. Indeed Allah does not like the treacherous.
rows.transliteration: wa immā takhāfanna min qawmin khiyānatan fanbidh ilayhim `alā sawā-i ۚ innallāha lā yuḥibbul khā-inīn

rows.arabic: وَلَا يَحْسَبَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ سَبَقُوٓا۟ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ لَا يُعْجِزُونَ
rows.translation: Let the faithless not suppose that they have outmanoeuvred [Allah]. Indeed, they cannot frustrate [His power].
rows.transliteration: walā yaḥsabannal ladhīna kafarū sabaqū ۚ innahum lā yu`jizūn

rows.arabic: وَأَعِدُّوا۟ لَهُم مَّا ٱسْتَطَعْتُم مِّن قُوَّةٍ وَمِن رِّبَاطِ ٱلْخَيْلِ تُرْهِبُونَ بِهِۦ عَدُوَّ ٱللَّهِ وَعَدُوَّكُمْ وَءَاخَرِينَ مِن دُونِهِمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُهُمْ ۚ وَمَا تُنفِقُوا۟ مِن شَىْءٍ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ يُوَفَّ إِلَيْكُمْ وَأَنتُمْ لَا تُظْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Prepare against them whatever you can of [military] power and war-horses, awing thereby the enemy of Allah, and your enemy, and others besides them, whom you do not know, but Allah knows them. And whatever you spend in the way of Allah will be repaid to you in full, and you will not be wronged.
rows.transliteration: wa-a`iddū lahum mas-taṭa`tum min quwwatin wa min ribāṭil khayli turhibūna bihi `aduwwallāhi wa`aduwwakum wa-ākharīna min dūnihim lā ta`lamūnahumullāhu ya`lamuhum ۚ wa mā tunfiqū min shay-in fī sabīlillāhi yuwaffa ilaykum wa-antum lā tuẓlamūn

rows.arabic: وَإِن جَنَحُوا۟ لِلسَّلْمِ فَٱجْنَحْ لَهَا وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
rows.translation: If they incline toward peace, then you [too] incline toward it, and put your trust in Allah. Indeed He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
rows.transliteration: wa in janaḥū lissal-mi fajnaḥ lahā watawakkal `alallāh ۚ innahu huwas samī`ul `alīm

rows.arabic: وَإِن يُرِيدُوٓا۟ أَن يَخْدَعُوكَ فَإِنَّ حَسْبَكَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَيَّدَكَ بِنَصْرِهِۦ وَبِٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: But if they desire to deceive you, Allah is indeed sufficient for you. It is He who strengthened you with His help and with the means of the faithful,
rows.transliteration: wa in yurīdū an yakhda`ūka fa-inna ḥasbakallāh ۚ huwal ladhī ayyadaka binaṣrihi wabil mu-minīn

rows.arabic: وَأَلَّفَ بَيْنَ قُلُوبِهِمْ ۚ لَوْ أَنفَقْتَ مَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا مَّآ أَلَّفْتَ بَيْنَ قُلُوبِهِمْ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ أَلَّفَ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
rows.translation: and united their hearts. Had you spent all that is in the earth, you could not have united their hearts, but Allah united them together. Indeed He is all-mighty, all-wise.
rows.transliteration: wa-allafa bayna qulūbihim ۚ law anfaqta mā fil-arḍi jamī`an mā allafta bayna qulūbihim walākinnallāha allafa baynahum ۚ innahu `azīzun ḥakīm

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ حَسْبُكَ ٱللَّهُ وَمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: O Prophet! Sufficient for you is Allah and those of the faithful who follow you.
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhan nabiyyu ḥasbukallāhu wa manit-taba`aka minal mu-minīn

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ حَرِّضِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَى ٱلْقِتَالِ ۚ إِن يَكُن مِّنكُمْ عِشْرُونَ صَـٰبِرُونَ يَغْلِبُوا۟ مِا۟ئَتَيْنِ ۚ وَإِن يَكُن مِّنكُم مِّا۟ئَةٌ يَغْلِبُوٓا۟ أَلْفًا مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَوْمٌ لَّا يَفْقَهُونَ
rows.translation: O Prophet! Urge on the faithful to fight: If there be twenty patient men among you, they shall overcome two hundred; and if there be a hundred of you, they shall overcome a thousand of the faithless, for they are a lot who do not understand.
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhan nabiyyu ḥarriḍil mu-minīna `alal-qitāl ۚ in yakun minkum `ishrūna ṣābirūna yaghlibū mī-atayn ۚ wa in yakun minkum mī-atun yaghlibū alfan minal ladhīna kafarū bi-annahum qawmul lā yafqahūn

rows.arabic: ٱلْـَٔـٰنَ خَفَّفَ ٱللَّهُ عَنكُمْ وَعَلِمَ أَنَّ فِيكُمْ ضَعْفًا ۚ فَإِن يَكُن مِّنكُم مِّا۟ئَةٌ صَابِرَةٌ يَغْلِبُوا۟ مِا۟ئَتَيْنِ ۚ وَإِن يَكُن مِّنكُمْ أَلْفٌ يَغْلِبُوٓا۟ أَلْفَيْنِ بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ مَعَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
rows.translation: Now Allah has lightened your burden, knowing that there is weakness in you. So if there be a hundred patient men among you, they shall overcome two hundred; and if there be a thousand, they shall overcome two thousand, by Allah’s leave; and Allah is with the patient.
rows.transliteration: al-āna khaffafallāhu `ankum wa`alima anna fīkum ḍa`fā ۚ fa-in yakun minkum mī-atun ṣābiratun yaghlibū mī-atayn ۚ wa in yakun minkum alfun yaghlibū alfayni bi-idhnillāh ۗ wallāhu ma`aṣ ṣābirīn

rows.arabic: مَا كَانَ لِنَبِىٍّ أَن يَكُونَ لَهُۥٓ أَسْرَىٰ حَتَّىٰ يُثْخِنَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ تُرِيدُونَ عَرَضَ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱللَّهُ يُرِيدُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ
rows.translation: A prophet may not take captives until he has thoroughly decimated [the enemy] in the land. You desire the transitory gains of this world, while Allah desires [for you] [the reward of] the Hereafter, and Allah is all-mighty, all-wise.
rows.transliteration: mā kāna linabiyyin an yakūna lahu asrā ḥattā yuthkhina fil-arḍ ۚ turīdūna `araḍad dunyā wallāhu yurīdul-ākhirah ۗ wallāhu `azīzun ḥakīm

rows.arabic: لَّوْلَا كِتَـٰبٌ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ سَبَقَ لَمَسَّكُمْ فِيمَآ أَخَذْتُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
rows.translation: Had it not been for a prior decree of Allah, surely there would have befallen you a great punishment for what you took.
rows.transliteration: lawlā kitābun minallāhi sabaqa lamassakum fīmā akhadhtum `adhābun `aẓīm

rows.arabic: فَكُلُوا۟ مِمَّا غَنِمْتُمْ حَلَـٰلًا طَيِّبًا ۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: Avail yourselves of the spoils you have taken as lawful and good, and be wary of Allah. Indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
rows.transliteration: fakulū mimmā ghanimtum ḥalālan ṭayyibā ۚ wattaqullāh ۚ innallāha ghafūrun raḥīm

rows.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ قُل لِّمَن فِىٓ أَيْدِيكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَسْرَىٰٓ إِن يَعْلَمِ ٱللَّهُ فِى قُلُوبِكُمْ خَيْرًا يُؤْتِكُمْ خَيْرًا مِّمَّآ أُخِذَ مِنكُمْ وَيَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: O Prophet! Say to the captives who are in your hands, ‘If Allah finds any good in your hearts, He will give you [something which is] better than what has been taken away from you, and He will forgive you, and Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.’
rows.transliteration: yā-ayyuhan nabiyyu qul liman fī aydīkum minal-asrā in ya`lamillāhu fī qulūbikum khayran yu-tikum khayran mimmā ukhidha minkum wayaghfir lakum ۗ wallāhu ghafūrun raḥīm

rows.arabic: وَإِن يُرِيدُوا۟ خِيَانَتَكَ فَقَدْ خَانُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مِن قَبْلُ فَأَمْكَنَ مِنْهُمْ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
rows.translation: But if they seek to betray you, then they have already betrayed Allah earlier, and He gave [you] power over them; and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.
rows.transliteration: wa in yurīdū khiyānataka faqad khānullāha min qablu fa-amkana minhum ۗ wallāhu `alīmun ḥakīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَهَاجَرُوا۟ وَجَـٰهَدُوا۟ بِأَمْوَٰلِهِمْ وَأَنفُسِهِمْ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَاوَوا۟ وَّنَصَرُوٓا۟ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ بَعْضُهُمْ أَوْلِيَآءُ بَعْضٍ ۚ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَلَمْ يُهَاجِرُوا۟ مَا لَكُم مِّن وَلَـٰيَتِهِم مِّن شَىْءٍ حَتَّىٰ يُهَاجِرُوا۟ ۚ وَإِنِ ٱسْتَنصَرُوكُمْ فِى ٱلدِّينِ فَعَلَيْكُمُ ٱلنَّصْرُ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍۭ بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَهُم مِّيثَـٰقٌ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
rows.translation: Indeed those who have believed and migrated and waged jihad with their possessions and persons in the way of Allah, and those who gave [them] shelter and help—they are heirs of one another. As for those who have believed but did not migrate, you have no heirdom in relation to them whatsoever until they migrate. Yet if they ask your help for the sake of religion, it is incumbent on you to help them, excepting against a people with whom you have a treaty; and Allah watches what you do.
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna āmanū wahājarū wajāhadū bi-amwālihim wa-anfusihim fī sabīlillāhi wal ladhīna āwaw wanaṣarū ulā-ika ba`ḍuhum awliyā-u ba`ḍ ۚ wal ladhīna āmanū walam yuhājirū mā lakum min walāyatihim min shay-in ḥattā yuhājirū ۚ wa inis-tanṣarūkum fid dīni fa`alaykumun naṣru illā `alā qawmin baynakum wabaynahum mīthāq ۗ wallāhu bimā ta`malūna baṣīr

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بَعْضُهُمْ أَوْلِيَآءُ بَعْضٍ ۚ إِلَّا تَفْعَلُوهُ تَكُن فِتْنَةٌ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَفَسَادٌ كَبِيرٌ
rows.translation: As for the faithless, they are heirs of one another. Unless you do the same, there will be strife in the land and great corruption.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna kafarū ba`ḍuhum awliyā-u ba`ḍ ۚ illā taf`alūhu takun fitnatun fil-arḍi wafasādun kabīr

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَهَاجَرُوا۟ وَجَـٰهَدُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَاوَوا۟ وَّنَصَرُوٓا۟ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ حَقًّا ۚ لَّهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌ وَرِزْقٌ كَرِيمٌ
rows.translation: Those who have believed, migrated, and waged jihad in the way of Allah, and those who gave them shelter and help, it is they who are truly the faithful. For them shall be forgiveness and a noble provision.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna āmanū wahājarū wajāhadū fī sabīlillāhi wal ladhīna āwaw wanaṣarū ulā-ika humul mu-minūna ḥaqqā ۚ lahum maghfiratun warizqun karīm

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدُ وَهَاجَرُوا۟ وَجَـٰهَدُوا۟ مَعَكُمْ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ مِنكُمْ ۚ وَأُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَرْحَامِ بَعْضُهُمْ أَوْلَىٰ بِبَعْضٍ فِى كِتَـٰبِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمٌۢ
rows.translation: Those who believed afterwards and migrated, and waged jihad along with you, they belong to you; but the blood relatives are more entitled to inherit from one another in the Book of Allah. Indeed Allah has knowledge of all things.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna āmanū min ba`du wahājarū wajāhadū ma`akum fa-ulā-ika minkum ۚ wa-ulul-arḥāmi ba`ḍuhum awlā biba`ḍin fī kitābillāh ۗ innallāha bikulli shay-in `alīm
